reviewText:
I don't really know why, but I'm running out of tissues, which is weird cause it's not like you get overloaded so you know everything about the characters, but the strife and pain have hit mah feels pretty hard, that or I'm being incredibly sensitive.

The artwork is wonderful and on a similar level to some of the higher end and priced visual novels out there.

The only gripe I have is this was either rushed for release because of a set steam release, as mentioned on the kickstarter email, the proof reader wasn't good enough or they didn't get a proof reader, but there are several rather obvious missing, misplaced, misspelt or gramatically poor sentence structure that makes a characters lines read poorly.

That gripe aside, for the price it's been released at on steam this is definately worth a punt, I have bought much worse for much more, although I backed a higher end tier on the kickstarted for this, so bonus goodies, but meh, it is a wonderful storey that I'm holding back from talking about to not gift out spoilers.

reviewText:
What will you do? If the fate of the world becomes your responsibility?
What will you do? If you are forced to leave the ones you love?
What will you do? If you know that you have little time left to live?

Millia -The Ending- is a rather short visual novel made by Millia Soft, with a few choices to make, of which those choices will lead to 3 different endings. Even though there are quite a number of translation errors throughout the game, the story is well written and very engaging. The art is beautiful and the song 'Akogare no hana' fits the story really well.

As stated above, Millia -The Ending- is the made by Millia Soft which is an indie VN studio and it is a cut above most of the other indie visual novels that are on Steam right now. Do consider reading Millia -The Ending- as it is worth your time and the game isn't too expensive. I am definitely looking forward to other works produced by MIllia Soft!

reviewText:
This game destroyed my night... I played it till the end in one go coz you just can't stop in the middle. At first I was just laughing about all the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t I have to put up in the story, but slowly I got immersed deeper.. and deeper... into the story to the point that I have nothing else to say. Great story, I would really hope they make the story even longer...

RIP my beauty sleep on the night of January 19th, 2015....

reviewText: Millia -The ending- is by far one of the best visual novels ive played. It's about how far one would go for love and happiness along with the feeling for on another being expressed. This was just a emotional and intersting novel to me and i wish there were more like, or even a series to the game. I really do recommend this game to anyone that loves visual novels and anime and would like a good story line about romance and the feeling for on another and how love will always prevail.

reviewText:
Millia -The Ending- is a short but sweet visual novel about the lengths one would go to protect the simles of loved ones. Despite the lack of polish overall, I fully enjoyed the story and what it had to offer. It's paced so well that I was able to become emotionally invested in these four characters in such a short amount of time, and every ending wraps up things nicely.

For $5, you can't go wrong with this purchase. It's not the end all of visual novels by any means, but I found it to be really refreshing compared to all the other VNs on Steam right now. I recommend it to those just looking for a casual, fun, and emotional read. Be wary that there is a lot of grammatical errors all throughout this work that certainly makes things a lot less impactful, but it's still a good read nonetheless.

Read my full review here: https://kupowrites.wordpress.com/2016/01/16/millia-the-ending-evn-review/

reviewText: This is one of the best VNs i have played so far. I am a big fan of choices and consequences, however this VN had few choices to choose from. Also those choices you don't get to see direct correlation until later in the game. By then you reliaze it might be too late (Thank God for save files......sooooo many.....). Story was well written. At times the grammar/spelling were so bad that I just wanted to quit. But the story kept pulling me in, I wanted to know what was going to happen next. Most VNs try to sell off body parts which can be very distracting while reading, but the curves here weren't demanding my attention which was nice. Overall great VN with a good price tag there are VNs out there that sell the curves and ask for a higher price tag but this VN makes up for it in story.
